column4: I don't know directly buy can try "lspci | grep Network controller" and then "dmesg | grep <name of your wifi card>".
i tried lsmod, a long list is returned and i don't know which one is wifi's driver, trying dmesg thingy
Yeah, lsmod is not very descriptive.
dmesg output doesn't contain the name of the wifi driver
Then pastebin outputs of dmesg, lsmod and lspci and I'll take a peek
should i paste whole output of dmesg in pastebin?
If you can, sure!
Well it seems lsmod should be the quickest way to see which driver your system uses, pastebin it soon, i have to go.
ok, i was installing pastebinit, pasting now
No, no. Pastebin is this: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org
http://paste.stgraber.org/2503
yes, i did lsmod | pastebinit
i am using Atheroes card
got the card name?
I would say your system uses the wlan kernel module, which is sidekicked by various ath_XYZ modules like ath_pci, ath_hal
i didn't get you
module should be a single name
i think the core module is wlan, is it?
Yeah, wlan
and in lsmod you can also see wlan is dependent on wlan_scan_sta,ath_rate_sample,ath_pciin your case
no, its the usedby column
